result.execSummary:
The defendant Donna L Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Conditions of Probation to be determined by the agent.

Submit DNA sample if not previously submitted.  DOC to remove $250 DNA cost upon proof of previous payment.

Total costs in the amount of $518 to be paid during the term of the probationary period.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Donna L Wright in court with attorney Lauria Ann Lynch-German.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel submits plea questionnaire and waiver.  Court examines the defendant as to the waiver.  Defendant enters a no contest plea.  Court accepts the plea, finding it to be free and voluntary, and finds the defendant guilty as to their plea.  State makes recommendation as to sentencing.  Counsel makes recommendation as to sentencing.  Court renders judgment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 6, 2017 at 09:15 am.

Court was advised that an alternate Defense Counsel would be appointed.  Hearing rescheduled for a date when new counsel is already scheduled to appear before this court.
